abstract: Indictment charges New York art dealer Hillel Nahmad with playing leading role in far-flung gambling and money-laundering operation that stretched from Russia to Los Angeles and New York; family's flagship art gallery at New York's Carlyle Hotel is raided by Federal Bureau of Investigation.
lead_paragraph: Indictments unsealed Tuesday outlined a case involving Russian gangsters, gambling, extortion and a family of art dealers with a gallery in the opulent Carlyle Hotel.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: James Barron, Colin Moynihan and Carol Vogel contributed reporting.

headline.main: Agents Descend on a New York Gallery, Charging Its Owner
headline.print_headline: A Powerful Art Dealer, Gambling and a Money-Laundering Case
headline.seo: Agents Raid Gallery in Carlyle Hotel in Gambling Probe

snippet: Indictments unsealed Tuesday outlined a case involving Russian gangsters, gambling, extortion and a family of art dealers with a gallery in the opulent Carlyle Hotel....
